name: Jessica
productName: WICKEDLY WELSH BRYN THE DRAGON EASTER EGG
review: Rural Pembrokeshire is the birthplace of actors Christian Bale and Rhys Ifans, and musician Gruff Rhys, but it's also the birthplace of a tiny dragon called Bryn. Nestled in the market town of Haverfordwest is Wickedly Welsh, a chocolatier specialising...

name: Sadia
productName: AUROSÓ CHOCOLATE INTRODUCES TWO NEW EASTER EGG TABLETS
review: Following the success of their Christmas florins, Oxfordshire's Aurosó Chocolate has introduced a couple of Easter Egg Tablets to their seasonal range. The Moonshine and Sunrise Easter Egg tablet flavours are identical to the smaller winter treats, but feature a...

name: Jesaly
review: Located on Regent Street and in the Westfield Shopping Centre at London's White City is a chocolate shop that looks more like a technology store from the outside. Expansive glazing allows you to peer through to see immaculately displayed products

name: Monas
review: As I planned my chocolate tour of London, I knew that a visit to Paul A. Young's Soho store on Wardour Street was a must. I visit every time I head to London to taste inspired and highly creative chocolate...

name: Rusa
review: Yes, I realise we're a month beyond Christmas and so, advent calendars are perhaps the last thing on your mind right now. In 2021, I had the pleasure of working through three calendars (you know, because one just wasn't enough!)....

name: Munia
review: My chocolate tour of London included a visit to one of my favourite Belgian chocolatiers, Pierre Marcolini. Nestled amongst architecturally splendid buildings in London's Marylebone High Street sits this quaint slice of Belgium. As I stepped inside the store, I...
